1<?php
2/**
3 * WordPress Coding Standard.
4 *
5 * @package WPCS\WordPressCodingStandards
6 * @link    https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress-Coding-Standards
7 * @license https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT MIT
8 */
9
10namespace WordPressCS\WordPress\Sniffs\DB;
11
12use WordPressCS\WordPress\Sniff;
13use PHP_CodeSniffer\Util\Tokens;
14
15/**
16 * Check for incorrect use of the $wpdb->prepare method.
17 *
18 * Check the following issues:
19 * - The only placeholders supported are: %d, %f (%F) and %s and their variations.
20 * - Literal % signs need to be properly escaped as `%%`.
21 * - Simple placeholders (%d, %f, %F, %s) should be left unquoted in the query string.
22 * - Complex placeholders - numbered and formatted variants - will not be quoted
23 *   automagically by $wpdb->prepare(), so if used for values, should be quoted in
24 *   the query string.
25 * - Either an array of replacements should be passed matching the number of
26 *   placeholders found or individual parameters for each placeholder should
27 *   be passed.
28 * - Wildcards for LIKE compare values should be passed in via a replacement parameter.
29 *
30 * The sniff allows for a specific pattern with a variable number of placeholders
31 * created using code along the lines of:
32 * `sprintf( 'query .... IN (%s) ...', implode( ',', array_fill( 0, count( $something ), '%s' ) ) )`.
33 *
34 * A "PreparedSQLPlaceholders replacement count" whitelist comment is supported
35 * specifically to silence the `ReplacementsWrongNumber` and `UnfinishedPrepare`
36 * error codes. The other error codes are not affected by it.
37 *
38 * @link https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/classes/wpdb/prepare/
39 * @link https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/41496
40 * @link https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/41471
41 *
42 * @package WPCS\WordPressCodingStandards
43 *
44 * @since   0.14.0
45 */
46class PreparedSQLPlaceholdersSniff extends Sniff {
47
48    /**
49     * These regexes copied from http://php.net/manual/en/function.sprintf.php#93552
50     * and adjusted for limitations in `$wpdb->prepare()`.
51     *
52     * Near duplicate of the one used in the WP.I18n sniff, but with fewer types allowed.
53     *
54     * Note: The regex delimiters and modifiers are not included to allow this regex to be
55     * concatenated together with other regex partials.
56     *
57     * @since 0.14.0
58     *
59     * @var string
60     */
61    const PREPARE_PLACEHOLDER_REGEX = '(?:
62        (?<![^%]%)                     # Don\'t match a literal % (%%), including when it could overlap with a placeholder.
63        (?:
64            %                          # Start of placeholder.
65            (?:[0-9]+\\\\?\$)?         # Optional ordering of the placeholders.
66            [+-]?                      # Optional sign specifier.
67            (?:
68                (?:0|\'.)?                 # Optional padding specifier - excluding the space.
69                -?                         # Optional alignment specifier.
70                [0-9]*                     # Optional width specifier.
71                (?:\.(?:[ 0]|\'.)?[0-9]+)? # Optional precision specifier with optional padding character.
72                |                      # Only recognize the space as padding in combination with a width specifier.
73                (?:[ ])?                   # Optional space padding specifier.
74                -?                         # Optional alignment specifier.
75                [0-9]+                     # Width specifier.
76                (?:\.(?:[ 0]|\'.)?[0-9]+)? # Optional precision specifier with optional padding character.
77            )
78            [dfFs]                     # Type specifier.
79        )
80    )';
81
82    /**
83     * Similar to above, but for the placeholder types *not* supported.
84     *
85     * Note: all optional parts are forced to be greedy to allow for the negative look ahead
86     * at the end to work.
87     *
88     * @since 0.14.0
89     *
90     * @var string
91     */
92    const UNSUPPORTED_PLACEHOLDER_REGEX = '`(?:
93        (?<!%)                     # Don\'t match a literal % (%%).
94        (
95            %                          # Start of placeholder.
96            (?!                        # Negative look ahead.
97                %[^%]                       # Not a correct literal % (%%).
98                |
99                %%[dfFs]                    # Nor a correct literal % (%%), followed by a simple placeholder.
100            )
101            (?:[0-9]+\\\\??\$)?+       # Optional ordering of the placeholders.
102            [+-]?+                     # Optional sign specifier.
103            (?:
104                (?:0|\'.)?+                 # Optional padding specifier - excluding the space.
105                -?+                         # Optional alignment specifier.
106                [0-9]*+                     # Optional width specifier.
107                (?:\.(?:[ 0]|\'.)?[0-9]+)?+ # Optional precision specifier with optional padding character.
108                |                      # Only recognize the space as padding in combination with a width specifier.
109                (?:[ ])?+                   # Optional space padding specifier.
110                -?+                         # Optional alignment specifier.
111                [0-9]++                     # Width specifier.
112                (?:\.(?:[ 0]|\'.)?[0-9]+)?+ # Optional precision specifier with optional padding character.
113            )
114            (?![dfFs])                 # Negative look ahead: not one of the supported placeholders.
115            (?:[^ \'"]*|$)             # but something else instead.
116        )
117    )`x';
118
119    /**
120     * List of $wpdb methods we are interested in.
121     *
122     * @since 0.14.0
123     *
124     * @var array
125     */
126    protected $target_methods = array(
127        'prepare' => true,
128    );
129
130    /**
131     * Storage for the stack pointer to the method call token.
132     *
133     * @since 0.14.0
134     *
135     * @var int
136     */
137    protected $methodPtr;
138
139    /**
140     * Simple regex snippet to recognize and remember quotes.
141     *
142     * @since 0.14.0
143     *
144     * @var string
145     */
146    private $regex_quote = '["\']';
147
148    /**
149     * Returns an array of tokens this test wants to listen for.
150     *
151     * @since 0.14.0
152     *
153     * @return array
154     */
155    public function register() {
156        return array(
157            \T_VARIABLE,
158            \T_STRING,
159        );
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Processes this test, when one of its tokens is encountered.
164     *
165     * @since 0.14.0
166     *
167     * @param int $stackPtr The position of the current token in the stack.
168     *
169     * @return void
170     */
171    public function process_token( $stackPtr ) {
172
173        if ( ! $this->is_wpdb_method_call( $stackPtr, $this->target_methods ) ) {
174            return;
175        }
176
177        $parameters = $this->get_function_call_parameters( $this->methodPtr );
178        if ( empty( $parameters ) ) {
179            return;
180        }
181
182        $query                    = $parameters[1];
183        $text_string_tokens_found = false;
184        $variable_found           = false;
185        $sql_wildcard_found       = false;
186        $total_placeholders       = 0;
187        $total_parameters         = \count( $parameters );
188        $valid_in_clauses         = array(
189            'uses_in'          => 0,
190            'implode_fill'     => 0,
191            'adjustment_count' => 0,
192        );
193
194        for ( $i = $query['start']; $i <= $query['end']; $i++ ) {
195            // Skip over groups of tokens if they are part of an inline function call.
196            if ( isset( $skip_from, $skip_to ) && $i >= $skip_from && $i < $skip_to ) {
197                $i = $skip_to;
198                continue;
199            }
200
201            if ( ! isset( Tokens::$textStringTokens[ $this->tokens[ $i ]['code'] ] ) ) {
202                if ( \T_VARIABLE === $this->tokens[ $i ]['code'] ) {
203                    if ( '$wpdb' !== $this->tokens[ $i ]['content'] ) {
204                        $variable_found = true;
205                    }
206                    continue;
207                }
208
209                // Detect a specific pattern for variable replacements in combination with `IN`.
210                if ( \T_STRING === $this->tokens[ $i ]['code'] ) {
211
212                    if ( 'sprintf' === strtolower( $this->tokens[ $i ]['content'] ) ) {
213                        $sprintf_parameters = $this->get_function_call_parameters( $i );
214
215                        if ( ! empty( $sprintf_parameters ) ) {
216                            $skip_from  = ( $sprintf_parameters[1]['end'] + 1 );
217                            $last_param = end( $sprintf_parameters );
218                            $skip_to    = ( $last_param['end'] + 1 );
219
220                            $valid_in_clauses['implode_fill']     += $this->analyse_sprintf( $sprintf_parameters );
221                            $valid_in_clauses['adjustment_count'] += ( \count( $sprintf_parameters ) - 1 );
222                        }
223                        unset( $sprintf_parameters, $last_param );
224
225                    } elseif ( 'implode' === strtolower( $this->tokens[ $i ]['content'] ) ) {
226                        $prev = $this->phpcsFile->findPrevious(
227                            Tokens::$textStringTokens,
228                            ( $i - 1 ),
229                            $query['start']
230                        );
231
232                        $prev_content = $this->strip_quotes( $this->tokens[ $prev ]['content'] );
233                        $regex_quote  = $this->get_regex_quote_snippet( $prev_content, $this->tokens[ $prev ]['content'] );
234
235                        // Only examine the implode if preceded by an ` IN (`.
236                        if ( preg_match( '`\s+IN\s*\(\s*(' . $regex_quote . ')?$`i', $prev_content, $match ) > 0 ) {
237
238                            if ( isset( $match[1] ) && $regex_quote !== $this->regex_quote ) {
239                                $this->phpcsFile->addError(
240                                    'Dynamic placeholder generation should not have surrounding quotes.',
241                                    $i,
242                                    'QuotedDynamicPlaceholderGeneration'
243                                );
244                            }
245
246                            if ( $this->analyse_implode( $i ) === true ) {
247                                ++$valid_in_clauses['uses_in'];
248                                ++$valid_in_clauses['implode_fill'];
249
250                                $next = $this->phpcsFile->findNext( Tokens::$emptyTokens, ( $i + 1 ), null, true );
251                                if ( \T_OPEN_PARENTHESIS === $this->tokens[ $next ]['code']
252                                    && isset( $this->tokens[ $next ]['parenthesis_closer'] )
253                                ) {
254                                    $skip_from = ( $i + 1 );
255                                    $skip_to   = ( $this->tokens[ $next ]['parenthesis_closer'] + 1 );
256                                }
257                            }
258                        }
259                        unset( $prev, $next, $prev_content, $regex_quote, $match );
260                    }
261                }
262
263                continue;
264            }
265
266            $text_string_tokens_found = true;
267            $content                  = $this->tokens[ $i ]['content'];
268
269            $regex_quote = $this->regex_quote;
270            if ( isset( Tokens::$stringTokens[ $this->tokens[ $i ]['code'] ] ) ) {
271                $content     = $this->strip_quotes( $content );
272                $regex_quote = $this->get_regex_quote_snippet( $content, $this->tokens[ $i ]['content'] );
273            }
274
275            if ( \T_DOUBLE_QUOTED_STRING === $this->tokens[ $i ]['code']
276                || \T_HEREDOC === $this->tokens[ $i ]['code']
277            ) {
278                // Only interested in actual query text, so strip out variables.
279                $stripped_content = $this->strip_interpolated_variables( $content );
280                if ( $stripped_content !== $content ) {
281                    $interpolated_vars = $this->get_interpolated_variables( $content );
282                    $vars_without_wpdb = array_diff( $interpolated_vars, array( 'wpdb' ) );
283                    $content           = $stripped_content;
284
285                    if ( ! empty( $vars_without_wpdb ) ) {
286                        $variable_found = true;
287                    }
288                }
289                unset( $stripped_content, $interpolated_vars, $vars_without_wpdb );
290            }
291
292            $placeholders = preg_match_all( '`' . self::PREPARE_PLACEHOLDER_REGEX . '`x', $content, $matches );
293            if ( $placeholders > 0 ) {
294                $total_placeholders += $placeholders;
295            }
296
297            /*
298             * Analyse the query for incorrect LIKE queries.
299             *
300             * - `LIKE %s` is the only correct one.
301             * - `LIKE '%s'` or `LIKE "%s"` will not be reported here, but in the quote check.
302             * - Any other `LIKE` statement should be reported, either for using `LIKE` without
303             *   SQL wildcards or for not passing the SQL wildcards via the replacement.
304             */
305            $regex = '`\s+LIKE\s*(?:(' . $regex_quote . ')(?!%s(?:\1|$))(?P<content>.*?)(?:\1|$)|(?:concat\((?![^\)]*%s[^\)]*\))(?P<concat>[^\)]*))\))`i';
306            if ( preg_match_all( $regex, $content, $matches ) > 0 ) {
307                $walk = array();
308                if ( ! empty( $matches['content'] ) ) {
309                    $matches['content'] = array_filter( $matches['content'] );
310                    if ( ! empty( $matches['content'] ) ) {
311                        $walk[] = 'content';
312                    }
313                }
314                if ( ! empty( $matches['concat'] ) ) {
315                    $matches['concat'] = array_filter( $matches['concat'] );
316                    if ( ! empty( $matches['concat'] ) ) {
317                        $walk[] = 'concat';
318                    }
319                }
320
321                if ( ! empty( $walk ) ) {
322                    foreach ( $walk as $match_key ) {
323                        foreach ( $matches[ $match_key ] as $index => $match ) {
324                            $data = array( $matches[0][ $index ] );
325
326                            // Both a `%` as well as a `_` are wildcards in SQL.
327                            if ( strpos( $match, '%' ) === false && strpos( $match, '_' ) === false ) {
328                                $this->phpcsFile->addWarning(
329                                    'Unless you are using SQL wildcards, using LIKE is inefficient. Use a straight compare instead. Found: %s.',
330                                    $i,
331                                    'LikeWithoutWildcards',
332                                    $data
333                                );
334                            } else {
335                                $sql_wildcard_found = true;
336
337                                if ( strpos( $match, '%s' ) === false ) {
338                                    $this->phpcsFile->addError(
339                                        'SQL wildcards for a LIKE query should be passed in through a replacement parameter. Found: %s.',
340                                        $i,
341                                        'LikeWildcardsInQuery',
342                                        $data
343                                    );
344                                } else {
345                                    $this->phpcsFile->addError(
346                                        'SQL wildcards for a LIKE query should be passed in through a replacement parameter and the variable part of the replacement should be escaped using "esc_like()". Found: %s.',
347                                        $i,
348                                        'LikeWildcardsInQueryWithPlaceholder',
349                                        $data
350                                    );
351                                }
352                            }
353
354                            /*
355                             * Don't throw `UnescapedLiteral`, `UnsupportedPlaceholder` or `QuotedPlaceholder`
356                             * for this part of the SQL query.
357                             */
358                            $content = preg_replace( '`' . preg_quote( $match, '`' ) . '`', '', $content, 1 );
359                        }
360                    }
361                }
362                unset( $matches, $index, $match, $data );
363            }
364
365            if ( strpos( $content, '%' ) === false ) {
366                continue;
367            }
368
369            /*
370             * Analyse the query for unsupported placeholders.
371             */
372            if ( preg_match_all( self::UNSUPPORTED_PLACEHOLDER_REGEX, $content, $matches ) > 0 ) {
373                if ( ! empty( $matches[0] ) ) {
374                    foreach ( $matches[0] as $match ) {
375                        if ( '%' === $match ) {
376                            $this->phpcsFile->addError(
377                                'Found unescaped literal "%%" character.',
378                                $i,
379                                'UnescapedLiteral',
380                                array( $match )
381                            );
382                        } else {
383                            $this->phpcsFile->addError(
384                                'Unsupported placeholder used in $wpdb->prepare(). Found: "%s".',
385                                $i,
386                                'UnsupportedPlaceholder',
387                                array( $match )
388                            );
389                        }
390                    }
391                }
392                unset( $match, $matches );
393            }
394
395            /*
396             * Analyse the query for quoted placeholders.
397             */
398            $regex = '`(' . $regex_quote . ')%[dfFs]\1`';
399            if ( preg_match_all( $regex, $content, $matches ) > 0 ) {
400                if ( ! empty( $matches[0] ) ) {
401                    foreach ( $matches[0] as $match ) {
402                        $this->phpcsFile->addError(
403                            'Simple placeholders should not be quoted in the query string in $wpdb->prepare(). Found: %s.',
404                            $i,
405                            'QuotedSimplePlaceholder',
406                            array( $match )
407                        );
408                    }
409                }
410                unset( $match, $matches );
411            }
412
413            /*
414             * Analyse the query for unquoted complex placeholders.
415             */
416            $regex = '`(?<!' . $regex_quote . ')' . self::PREPARE_PLACEHOLDER_REGEX . '(?!' . $regex_quote . ')`x';
417            if ( preg_match_all( $regex, $content, $matches ) > 0 ) {
418                if ( ! empty( $matches[0] ) ) {
419                    foreach ( $matches[0] as $match ) {
420                        if ( preg_match( '`%[dfFs]`', $match ) !== 1 ) {
421                            $this->phpcsFile->addWarning(
422                                'Complex placeholders used for values in the query string in $wpdb->prepare() will NOT be quoted automagically. Found: %s.',
423                                $i,
424                                'UnquotedComplexPlaceholder',
425                                array( $match )
426                            );
427                        }
428                    }
429                }
430                unset( $match, $matches );
431            }
432
433            /*
434             * Check for an ` IN (%s)` clause.
435             */
436            $found_in = preg_match_all( '`\s+IN\s*\(\s*%s\s*\)`i', $content, $matches );
437            if ( $found_in > 0 ) {
438                $valid_in_clauses['uses_in'] += $found_in;
439            }
440            unset( $found_in );
441        }
442
443        if ( false === $text_string_tokens_found ) {
444            // Query string passed in as a variable or function call, nothing to examine.
445            return;
446        }
447
448        $count_diff_whitelisted = $this->has_whitelist_comment(
449            'PreparedSQLPlaceholders replacement count',
450            $stackPtr
451        );
452
453        if ( 0 === $total_placeholders ) {
454            if ( 1 === $total_parameters ) {
455                if ( false === $variable_found && false === $sql_wildcard_found ) {
456                    /*
457                     * Only throw this warning if the PreparedSQL sniff won't throw one about
458                     * variables being found.
459                     * Also don't throw it if we just advised to use a replacement variable to pass a
460                     * string containing an SQL wildcard.
461                     */
462                    $this->phpcsFile->addWarning(
463                        'It is not necessary to prepare a query which doesn\'t use variable replacement.',
464                        $i,
465                        'UnnecessaryPrepare'
466                    );
467                }
468            } elseif ( false === $count_diff_whitelisted && 0 === $valid_in_clauses['uses_in'] ) {
469                $this->phpcsFile->addWarning(
470                    'Replacement variables found, but no valid placeholders found in the query.',
471                    $i,
472                    'UnfinishedPrepare'
473                );
474            }
475
476            return;
477        }
478
479        if ( 1 === $total_parameters ) {
480            $this->phpcsFile->addError(
481                'Placeholders found in the query passed to $wpdb->prepare(), but no replacements found. Expected %d replacement(s) parameters.',
482                $stackPtr,
483                'MissingReplacements',
484                array( $total_placeholders )
485            );
486            return;
487        }
488
489        if ( true === $count_diff_whitelisted ) {
490            return;
491        }
492
493        $replacements = $parameters;
494        array_shift( $replacements ); // Remove the query.
495
496        // The parameters may have been passed as an array in parameter 2.
497        if ( isset( $parameters[2] ) && 2 === $total_parameters ) {
498            $next = $this->phpcsFile->findNext(
499                Tokens::$emptyTokens,
500                $parameters[2]['start'],
501                ( $parameters[2]['end'] + 1 ),
502                true
503            );
504
505            if ( false !== $next
506                && ( \T_ARRAY === $this->tokens[ $next ]['code']
507                    || \T_OPEN_SHORT_ARRAY === $this->tokens[ $next ]['code'] )
508            ) {
509                $replacements = $this->get_function_call_parameters( $next );
510            }
511        }
512
513        $total_replacements  = \count( $replacements );
514        $total_placeholders -= $valid_in_clauses['adjustment_count'];
515
516        // Bow out when `IN` clauses have been used which appear to be correct.
517        if ( $valid_in_clauses['uses_in'] > 0
518            && $valid_in_clauses['uses_in'] === $valid_in_clauses['implode_fill']
519            && 1 === $total_replacements
520        ) {
521            return;
522        }
523
524        /*
525         * Verify that the correct amount of replacements have been passed.
526         */
527        if ( $total_replacements !== $total_placeholders ) {
528            $this->phpcsFile->addWarning(
529                'Incorrect number of replacements passed to $wpdb->prepare(). Found %d replacement parameters, expected %d.',
530                $stackPtr,
531                'ReplacementsWrongNumber',
532                array( $total_replacements, $total_placeholders )
533            );
534        }
535    }
536
537    /**
538     * Retrieve a regex snippet to recognize and remember quotes based on the quote style
539     * used in the original string (if any).
540     *
541     * This allows for recognizing `"` and `\'` in single quoted strings,
542     * recognizing `'` and `\"` in double quotes strings and `'` and `"`when the quote
543     * style is unknown or it is a non-quoted string (heredoc/nowdoc and such).
544     *
545     * @since 0.14.0
546     *
547     * @param string $stripped_content Text string content without surrounding quotes.
548     * @param string $original_content Original content for the same text string.
549     *
550     * @return string
551     */
552    protected function get_regex_quote_snippet( $stripped_content, $original_content ) {
553        $regex_quote = $this->regex_quote;
554
555        if ( $original_content !== $stripped_content ) {
556            $quote_style = $original_content[0];
557
558            if ( '"' === $quote_style ) {
559                $regex_quote = '\\\\"|\'';
560            } elseif ( "'" === $quote_style ) {
561                $regex_quote = '"|\\\\\'';
562            }
563        }
564
565        return $regex_quote;
566    }
567
568    /**
569     * Analyse a sprintf() query wrapper to see if it contains a specific code pattern
570     * to deal correctly with `IN` queries.
571     *
572     * The pattern we are searching for is:
573     * `sprintf( 'query ....', implode( ',', array_fill( 0, count( $something ), '%s' ) ) )`
574     *
575     * @since 0.14.0
576     *
577     * @param array $sprintf_params Parameters details for the sprintf call.
578     *
579     * @return int The number of times the pattern was found in the replacements.
580     */
581    protected function analyse_sprintf( $sprintf_params ) {
582        $found = 0;
583
584        unset( $sprintf_params[1] );
585
586        foreach ( $sprintf_params as $sprintf_param ) {
587            if ( strpos( strtolower( $sprintf_param['raw'] ), 'implode' ) === false ) {
588                continue;
589            }
590
591            $implode = $this->phpcsFile->findNext(
592                Tokens::$emptyTokens,
593                $sprintf_param['start'],
594                $sprintf_param['end'],
595                true
596            );
597            if ( \T_STRING === $this->tokens[ $implode ]['code']
598                && 'implode' === strtolower( $this->tokens[ $implode ]['content'] )
599            ) {
600                if ( $this->analyse_implode( $implode ) === true ) {
601                    ++$found;
602                }
603            }
604        }
605
606        return $found;
607    }
608
609    /**
610     * Analyse an implode() function call to see if it contains a specific code pattern
611     * to dynamically create placeholders.
612     *
613     * The pattern we are searching for is:
614     * `implode( ',', array_fill( 0, count( $something ), '%s' ) )`
615     *
616     * This pattern presumes unquoted placeholders!
617     *
618     * @since 0.14.0
619     *
620     * @param int $implode_token The stackPtr to the implode function call.
621     *
622     * @return bool True if the pattern is found, false otherwise.
623     */
624    protected function analyse_implode( $implode_token ) {
625        $implode_params = $this->get_function_call_parameters( $implode_token );
626
627        if ( empty( $implode_params ) || \count( $implode_params ) !== 2 ) {
628            return false;
629        }
630
631        if ( preg_match( '`^(["\']), ?\1$`', $implode_params[1]['raw'] ) !== 1 ) {
632            return false;
633        }
634
635        if ( strpos( strtolower( $implode_params[2]['raw'] ), 'array_fill' ) === false ) {
636            return false;
637        }
638
639        $array_fill = $this->phpcsFile->findNext(
640            Tokens::$emptyTokens,
641            $implode_params[2]['start'],
642            $implode_params[2]['end'],
643            true
644        );
645
646        if ( \T_STRING !== $this->tokens[ $array_fill ]['code']
647            || 'array_fill' !== strtolower( $this->tokens[ $array_fill ]['content'] )
648        ) {
649            return false;
650        }
651
652        $array_fill_params = $this->get_function_call_parameters( $array_fill );
653
654        if ( empty( $array_fill_params ) || \count( $array_fill_params ) !== 3 ) {
655            return false;
656        }
657
658        return (bool) preg_match( '`^(["\'])%[dfFs]\1$`', $array_fill_params[3]['raw'] );
659    }
660
661}

Legend

Covered by small (and larger) testsCovered by medium (and large) testsCovered by large tests (and tests of unknown size)Not coveredNot coverable
